jdbc.query

Class OrderQueries

  • java.lang.Object
    • jdbc.query.OrderQueries

  • public class OrderQueries
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles all database operations related to orders, including fetching, inserting, updating, and deleting orders within the park management system. This class provides methods to interact with both preorder and occasional visit tables, manage order statuses, search for available dates, and more, ensuring the orders are correctly processed and managed in the database. Tamer Amer, Gal Bitton, Rabea Lahham, Bahaldeen Swied, Ron Sisso, Nadav Reubens.

    • Method Detail

      • fetchOrderByOrderID

        public ServerResponse fetchOrderByOrderID(Order order)
        Gets an order and checks if it's in DB
        Parameters:
        order - - the order to search for. *already initialized*
        Returns:
        on Success: returns Order_Found_Successfully on Failure: returns Such_Order_Does_Not_Exists exception: returns Exception_Was_Thrown

      • checkAvailableSpotInParkAtSpecificHour

        public java.lang.Integer[] checkAvailableSpotInParkAtSpecificHour(java.time.LocalDateTime timeToCheck,
                                                                  java.lang.Integer parkId)
        gets an order and checks if the current date and time is available for a specific park
        Parameters:
        timeToCheck - The LocalDateTime representing the specific hour to check for available spots.
        parkId - The Integer ID of the park for which to check the available spots.
        Returns:
        An array of Integer, where the first element is the number of spots currently occupied (null if no data is found) and the second element is the calculated number of available spots at the given time. Returns null in case of a database error.

      • searchForAvailableDates7DaysForward

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.time.LocalDateTime> searchForAvailableDates7DaysForward(Order order)
        Searches for available dates for an order within the next 7 days from the specified enter date in the order. This method checks the availability based on the park's current capacity and estimated visit time, ensuring there are enough spots for the number of visitors in the order.
        Parameters:
        order - The order for which the available dates are being searched. The order must contain the park's ID, enter date, and the number of visitors.
        Returns:
        A list of LocalDateTime objects representing the available dates and times for the next 7 days where the order can be placed. The list will be empty if no available dates are found.

      • isThisDateAvailable

        public boolean isThisDateAvailable(int parkId,
                                   java.time.LocalDateTime enterTime,
                                   int amountOfVisitors)
        Checks if a specific date and time is available for a new order in a given park, considering the number of visitors and the park's capacity at that time.
        Parameters:
        parkId - The ID of the park where the availability is being checked.
        enterTime - The LocalDateTime representing the desired entry date and time for the visit.
        amountOfVisitors - The number of visitors for which the availability needs to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the date and time are available for the specified number of visitors, false otherwise.

      • fetchOrderByOwnerID

        public ServerResponse fetchOrderByOwnerID(Order order)
        Searches an order in DB using ownerId, ownerId is the user which owns the order
        Parameters:
        order - - contains the ownerId
        Returns:
        on success returns Order_Found_Successfully on failure returns Such_Order_Does_Not_Exists exception: returns Excpetion_Was_Thrown

      • updateOrderStatus

        public boolean updateOrderStatus(Order order,
                                 OrderStatusEnum statusToUpdate)
        gets an order and changes its status according statusToUpdate in DB, also changes the status in the given entity order.
        Parameters:
        order - - the order where the change of its status will be made
        statusToUpdate - - the status we should change the order to.
        Returns:
        on success returns true on failure returns false

      • checkIfNewOrderAvailableAtRequestedDate

        public ServerResponse checkIfNewOrderAvailableAtRequestedDate(Order order)
        Checks if a new order can be placed on the requested date considering the park's capacity and the number of visitors already scheduled for that day. It calculates if the number of visitors in the park, including the potential new order, would exceed the park's capacity at any time during the visit.
        Parameters:
        order - The order to be checked, containing the park ID, the number of visitors, and the enter date.
        Returns:
        ServerResponse indicating whether the requested date is available, unavailable, has too many visitors, or if a failure occurred during the process.

      • insertOrderIntoDB

        public boolean insertOrderIntoDB(Order order)
        Gets an order and adds it to the pre-order table in DB
        Parameters:
        order - - the requested order to add in DB
        Returns:
        on Success: returns Order_Added_Into_Table on Failure: returns Failed exception: returns Exception_Was_Thrown

      • updateOrderPhoneNumber

        public ServerResponse updateOrderPhoneNumber(Order order)
        Gets an order and updates its phone number in the DB
        Parameters:
        order - - must be already initialized with the updated phone number
        Returns:
        on success returns Order_PhoneNumber_Updated on Failure: returns Failed exception: returns Exception_Was_Thrown

        Returns:

      • returnTotalPreOrdersWithStatus

        public int returnTotalPreOrdersWithStatus(OrderStatusEnum status)

      • searchForNotifiedOrdersOfSpecificClient

        public java.util.ArrayList<Order> searchForNotifiedOrdersOfSpecificClient(java.lang.String customerId)
        Retrieves a list of orders that have been notified or are in the notified waiting list for a specific client. This method is useful for fetching orders that might require action or acknowledgment from the client's side.
        Parameters:
        customerId - The ID of the customer whose notified orders are to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Order objects that have been either notified or are in the notified waiting list for the specified customer. Returns null if an SQLException occurs or if there are no such orders.

      • notifyTheNextOrdersInWaitingList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Order> notifyTheNextOrdersInWaitingList(java.time.LocalDateTime enterDate,
                                                                   int parkId)
        Notifies the next orders in the waiting list for a specific park and enter date. This method is typically called when there is a cancellation, and spots open up in the park, allowing waiting list orders to be potentially moved to confirmed status.
        Parameters:
        enterDate - The enter date for which the waiting list orders are being notified.
        parkId - The ID of the park where the waiting list orders are placed.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Order objects that are next in line on the waiting list for the specified enter date and park. Returns null if an SQLException occurs or if there are no orders in the waiting list.

      • importAllOrdersForToday

        public java.util.ArrayList<Order> importAllOrdersForToday(int parkId)
        Retrieves all orders, both from preorders and occasional visits, that are scheduled for today at a specific park. This method is useful for park management to get a quick overview of all the expected visits for the current day.
        Parameters:
        parkId - The ID of the park for which the orders are to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Order objects that are scheduled for today for the specified park. Returns an empty list if there are no orders for today or null if an SQLException occurs.

      • deleteOrderFromTable

        public boolean deleteOrderFromTable(Order order)
        Deletes a specific order from the preorders table in the database. This operation is irreversible and should be used with caution, typically in scenarios where an order is cancelled or needs to be removed for some reason.
        Parameters:
        order - The Order object containing the ID of the order to be deleted.
        Returns:
        true if the order was successfully deleted; false if the deletion failed, either because the order does not exist or due to an SQLException.
